review: My husband and I have been to CPK many times in the Waterford Lakes Shopping Center. The food is always great! You can sit at a booth or table inside as well as at the bar overlooking the kitchen for quick service or even outside with your dog!   Last night we shared a Full Caramelized Peach Salad with mixed greens, peaches, dried cranberries, gorgonzola, red onions, toasted pecans and a white balsalmic dressing - super YUM and a thin crust traditional/original BBQ Chicken Pizza. Great food, great service, clean. We'll be back in a few weeks, I'm sure!

It was my first time at CPK yesterday.  I don't normally prefer pizza but I was taken by surprise when I took my first bite of a garlic chicken pizza. It was absolutely delicious! I also had the best strawberry lemonade I have ever had too! It was packed full of flavor and just enough tartness to not be over powering.  My only grip is that it's a little on the expensive side. I won't be able to afford coming here often. For around twelve dollars you get a rather small pizza. The drinks were about three buck so it all added up pretty fast. My friend and I had a dog with us so we sat outside. After not being noticed for a while I came in and alerted the hostess. She came back out with menus and told us our server should be with us soon. After 20mins an apologetic waitress came out and took our orders.  Despite the mess up the staff remained very friendly and even offered us free drinks. Overall it was a great environment with great food and would definitely recommend it.

It was 6pm when we arrive.  Normal crowds, it wasn't slow but not quite busy either.  So far So good.  We ordered our food and drinks.  The waitress forgot my bf drink.  The appetizer she brought out was not as warm as we like but we let it go.  Artichoke dip and chips, I think the dip should be hot.  Anyway the entire time she did not once stop by.  My bf was getting pissed.  Finally, our pizza come it was a dry and not as hot as it should be.  The total experience is not good at all.  I don't think we would come back again.

The bar-b-q chicken pizza is always my favorite. It is always a constant in terms of the flavor and quality.  The CPK at Waterford Lakes is always clean and the staff friendly. Never really had a bad experience, and that should say something about the management!
Food is great, the meet cravers pizza is a must, as well as the Belgian chocolate dessert. The problem? Service is slow (10 mins to get the dessert) and not the friendliest people.
Meh.  I rather eat at Mellow Mushroom, where I know my pizzas are prepared fresh.  The pizza at this restaurant tastes like their supermarket, frozen versions!

Reliable on salads and soups, which are consistently good. Big and not too cramped, so the noise level is fine. Relaxing patio seating outdoors, to enjoy a Florida winter evening. Yes, it's a chain but I like it as well as any other restaurants in Waterford Lakes. No upsell pressure on your order. Have a small salad or a splurge feast, you get the same friendly service.  They have an affinity card of some kind but it's confusing (what the point system is.) I gave up on it. Good place.

Stopped by for a quick bite after a movie.  Great selection of food.  I usually go with the pizzas, but was surprisingly not hungry.  I went with the Tortilla Spring rolls: 1 of each to be exact.  Very satisfying, and the sauces were superb.  My fave was the  tai chicken.  The beer selection was decent, though not many on tap.  Whether you're starving or just looking for a quick bite and a beer, this place hits the spot.

Although it's a chain and I try not to review chains, I have to give CPK props.  Each time we go here the food and service are consistently good.  Its this consistency that makes it 4 stars, but its still corporate, so I drop it a star for that.   Sicilian Pizza has a great thin crust and the meats are tasty.  The cobb with beets is ample and fresh.

My family and I come here probably 2-3 times a month. Food is very good! I looooove their sandwiches. Although, I don't know why they got rid of the cranberry chicken salad sandwich. That was my favorite, so I was a little ticked. Their other sandwiches and southwestern chicken rolls more than make up for it. :) The service is typically pretty good, but we go more for the food. I'm sure we will be back very soon.

$70 Buys You Paper Napkins, Denim Clad Servers, and Sugar Ants Marching Across The Table?  Really?!? I have been eating at CPK for years.  Since the late 90's in Ft. Lauderdale when they first opened on 441.  Low lighting, button down black collar staff, linen napkins, black straws, white drink napkins with the CPK logo printed in brilliant yellow, the smell of wood from the stove filling the entire restaurant with a timeless aroma, all served to the state of elegance CPK's upscale dining experience warranted.  The Peking Duck pizza was a favorite, sadly no longer on the menu, of our family's outings. I moved and left for college at UCF and was overjoyed when they opened one at Waterford Lakes.  The restaurant was not quite as nice as the one I remembered from my hometown, but it was still just as good.  It used to be a sure thing for dates because finger foods like pizza mean neither party worries about manners and can focus more on each other.   Recently, I took my girlfriend there to give her the dining experience I remembered loving.  It was date night.  Knowing the price of the restaurant, I expected a certain level of class.  When you go to dinner, you pay not just for the food, but the dining experience.  I was raised that you dress appropriately to respect that ambiance.  To respect the food and the atmosphere.  And to show that same respect to the other patrons sharing the experience with you.  This time though, was a stark contrast to what I was expecting. We were seated in a booth between two others each of which were seated with couples on a similar date, each dressed appropriately for the situation and enjoying quiet dinner conversation.  My girl was seated to face the back of the restaurant, I was seated to face the entrance.  Our server arrived promptly, but was wearing jeans and a utilitarian style button shirt.  Something like you'd expect a server to wear at a low class steakhouse, not an upscale gourmet pizza restaurant.  She placed cutlery on the table and I noticed they were wrapped in paper napkins, not black linen.  The drinks were not placed on white coasters with the yellow CPK logo, but instead just a brown paper square.  The menu was not in a leather bound black sleeve and printed on brilliant white cardstock with the logo printed in brilliant yellow, but was just a laminated folded paper, stained with drippings from previous patrons.  She was polite and took our order, but was more mall attitude instead of professional. She brought the order and the food was much like I'd remembered so that was good, but then I watched as two tables away, two UCF students, wearing t-shirts and sweat pants, dumped a cup of ice water all over the floor, and proceeded to laugh hysterically while kicking ice around the floor with their flip flops.  The date seated between them and us, the girl became exasperated and the guy was pissed.  Considering what the meal cost, I completely understand.  It's supposed to be a class above Olive Garden, and they were acting like drunken 4am Denny's.  Why the manager didn't eject them, I'll never know.  But it was then that I looked around and saw, the restaurant had gone completely down hill.  I saw some patrons trying to give the place the level of respect it deserved, but very few adults.  Mostly, I saw too many college kids and most of them were underdressed.  At the minimum, the hostess should have separated the patrons between adults and daters, and plebeian masses.  It was a shame to see a place I'd once respected as an eatery turn to this.  Then I noticed our table was loose and falling away from the wall, tilting everything towards the aisle center floor.  And as I looked at the strange angle of the table I noticed a small parade of sugar ants marching across from the wall towards the edge of the booth.  I was in disbelief.  And then the bill came.  This whole debacle had cost me $70 with tip for two pizzas, drinks, salad and an appetizer.  $70.  $70 For paper napkins, and the amateur NHL two booths away.  For jean clad staff and raucous noise.  $70 for a parade of ants where we eat our food. It felt like I got sub par TGI Fridays, for twice the price.  Needless to say, I will not be returning anytime soon.  And it's sad.  The food at CPK is great, quite excellent in fact.  That has not changed.  But the experience and the atmosphere just do not reflect what that place costs.  Not anymore.  And if you think that you aren't paying for the experience when you go out to eat, well, think about this; how many wedding proposals happen at your local Denny's, and how many happened at Manuel's On The 28th.  Would you suit up for a $100 4 course meal, or a $5 grand slam?  I'll be returning when CPK returns to it's former glory.  Till then, if I get a craving for CPK, I'll hit my grocer's freezer section.
We eat here a lot, and the food is always good. Service is always fast too. I love having this available in Waterford.

I thought this place was great! The pizzas are huge so if you can agree on a pizza share one. I left more on my plate than I ate. The complimentary bread and oil was delicious and if you're gluten free you have many options here. Nice selection of bottled beer and my server Natalia was great. Definitely looking forward to coming back.

I don't know what happened here. I overheard a server telling the table next to us that at some point the restaurant came under new ownership, so maybe that has something to do with it. From the day this place opened (more years ago than I care to think about) until a couple of years ago, I loved this restaurant and ate here often.  My favorite pizza, the Thai Chicken Pizza, was always delicious.  I kept coming back to it, although over my many visits I did have just about every pizza on their menu. I stopped coming here a couple of years ago when I started really trying to eat healthier.  The pizzas are all more than 1,000 calories each, making them difficult to justify when you want to lose weight.  All the same, my cravings for the Thai Chicken Pizza never abated and after a long absence I decided to treat myself and come in for dinner. Of course, I ordered the Thai Chicken Pizza.  What I got was something else.  This was less of a pizza and more of a round flatbread with carrots and sprouts thrown on top.  What is this thing?! What little sauce (and even less cheese) was baked on to the crust tasted similar to the pizza I remember, but there was absolutely nothing to it.  Then they ramped up the carrots and sprouts on top. Maybe to give the illusion that the pizza is as big as it used to be?  It didn't work, obviously this thing is a shell of its former glory. And another thing happened that never happened during my previous visits -- I left hungry. Bring back my pizza and we'll talk.  Until then, I'm done with this place.

The worst experience ever. racist receptionists. We arrived the store tonight somewhere around six. Two front desk receptionist asked us to wait for half an hour. since we had 8 people,  I understood there might not be a large table available. so we waited. after half an hour to 45 minutes, then we see ppl came in after us sat down, I don't mean one or two, but a few other groups of  8 to 10 people. They sat right down.  Are we transparent? We asked why, the receptionist did not explain the reason and asked us whether we can sit in 2 separate tables.  This is a very 'good' customer service of urs.  We came in, there was still a lot more small tables available, but when u threw the question to us, the area was full. why you want us to wait longer when you could make us just sat right down when we came? I just think the two receptionists were so irresponsible  and did not even bother to apologize when we deciced to leave for other dining place. Upset and  for the racist part,  it is true. The manager please go figure out what happened. Skin color is not the ultimate priority for whoever and should not be a reason why your restaurant made us wait forever. so lets do math here. 1 hour per person for nothing equates to 8 hours for 8 ppl. your restaurant obviously  did not compensate for the lost 8 hours. no with a sincere apology or a goodbye.
The kung pao shrimp was outstanding. If you don't like it spicy just as them to take out the chili!!!

Over the years living in the Orlando area, I've definitely visited CPK multiple times. They offer a variety of dishes and types of food so it's good for going with a group of picky people. I'm currently a lacto-ovo vegetarian, so the number of options present for me to eat is one of the primary factors on whether I will return to a place or not. I love that CPK offers a separate menu online that lists which dishes are "safe" for me to eat. That takes a lot of the guess work in determining if a dish is meat-free or not. Overall, I always enjoy what I get at CPK. An order of the crispy Mac N Cheese is normally a must because who can resist cheesy-pasta that is deep fried? It has a good flavor, a soft inside, and nice crunchy outside. I normally get the white pizza or the roasted artichoke + spinach pizza. Both are delicious and offer an "above average" pizza for the Waterford lakes area. Although slightly pricier than other places in the area, I think its worth it due to the number of selections on the menu and the quality of their products.

This CPK has been around here forever! Like another patron from the reviewer had said CPK is not what is use to be but at least the food is good.  It's much more of a casual dining restaurant than the 'upscale california' feel. They have cut back on a few items such as no bread, paper wrapped silverware, and no percent discounts with affiliate partners. I know what I like from CPK and i rarely deter from it. I always order the chicken and shrimp lettuce wrap and the sicilian thin crust pizza. Those are my two favorites.  The lettuce wrap has a asian flair which is made with stir fried diced chicken with small shrimp and a soy base dipping sauce. They give you half head of lettuce to wrap the goodies. The sicilian is so thin and crispy with all kinds of italian meats on there.  On that visit I've also tried one of their small plates as part of their special right now. We ordered the Shaved Mushroom and Spinach. It was good and tasty however if it weren't for the promo, I highly doubt I would try it. It was about $6 for 4 slices of a 6 inch flat bread. I think it's much more practical to buy a pizza with that. Especially for mushroom and spinach. Maybe it was a new marketing project to bring in more customers but its not something that I would try again. The service was friendly and helpful. We sat outside but they still came out and checked on us like we were regular customers (I know servers haaate going in and out..trust me) Finally, one good thing about this place is that they have a nice outdoor patio seating area which they have renovated by adding cushion benches and a firepit. It is a great place to bring you dog and they welcome them.  One bad thing about it is that they indeed have a sugar ant problem......

Love this place! Pepperoni pizza is amazing. I have eaten here countless of times and I've never been disappointed. The new flatbread are awesome especially the Bianco. The staff is super friendly and it's nice watching the pizza cooks work their station.

A last minute to go order of the Thai chicken pizza is a must have on a rainy Monday. I have to admit that I have never been here for a meal... only to go. The thai chicken pizza is unique and flavorful. The to go service is quick and friendly. I will update everyone once I have tried something else or actually had a sit down meal here!

Awful customer service! We looked up dog friendly restaurants and came across California pizza kitchen, so we drove al the way over just to be turned away because it was suppose to rain later that night ( 4 hours later). In turn She said she could not sit the patio. It happened to be gorgeous out and not a cloud in sight. Probably a reason why the restaurant was empty. Taking my business else where.

I had notice this restaurant in Waterford and finally tried it after the TNT show "THE MENU".  They have a small lighter fare menu available all day.  I am driven to try different and new combinations.  So far I have had the Arugula and Asparagus salad and the new item from the show called "Korean BarBQ Pizza".  Both were excellent.  Pizza dough is Tossed and very yummy.  Service was excellent!  Atmosphere is casual with a touch of class.  The only reason I don't give it 5 STARS is because my taste buds like to try the unusual items first.  In the future I may go higher.

I had late lunch around 3PM. We got sat near the TV to watch the NFL game. We order Sangria and the drinks were awful. I look back to get my waiter attention but he wasn't around. I had to come out the booth to get the greeter to come over my table and get my drinks corrected. I order the food and the food came in time an tasted good. The waiter again, I was able to find him. I think he was having issues with his POS system. He was there for a while and I try to get his attention. I don't know, if I was wrong having lunch at 3PM but the service was not the same as before.
A last minute search for a place to eat on New Years Eve led us to California Pizza Kitchen. It did not disappoint.  We had drinks, appetizers and pizza. All was amazing.

I have been going to California Pizza Kitchen for a long time. A first time customer might only aim for their pizza selection, which are all perfectly delicious. This would be a disservice to the rest of the menu, though.  I almost always get the Tuscan Hummus appetizer to start. The warm pita bread and savory hummus are a great way to start off any meal. The flat-breads and especially the salads are some of my favorites around. If you get the BBQ Chicken Chopped Salad, spring for the avocado. You won't be disappointed. The Waterford Lakes store is either quiet or slammed depending on when during the week you might try to stop by. Even when they are completely full with customers, the wait staff is friendly and accomodating.

My friend and I came here one evening. Neither of us had gone or had any expectations, but he had a giftcard and didn't want to go alone. Our  server was a little out of it/not very attentive, but he could have been having an off night. He was not awful by any means. The pizza was really good! We each got one because I have a huge appetite and can devour anything, but we got the same thing. It wasn't until I was halfway through that I realized it didn't have any sauce. It was cheese, basil, and tomato and it was soooo good. I was definitely pleasantly surprised. The prices are more than I would normally pay for pizza (hence the rating), and I can't figure out what makes it so "special" that they can price it the way they do, but it was yummy pizza nonetheless. I'd be curious to try their frozen pizzas...but I'm sure they're not as good. The restaurant itself isn't anything special, it wouldn't be a bad place for a date. They had the tvs on with sports at the bar, so that might be a plus for some people!
Amazing service and amazing food! We went to this location for valentine's day and got the special they had going on. I got the kung pao spaghetti which is definitely worth going back there for!
Had the Turkey Club sandwich for lunch, by evening I was down with food poisoning, listeria maybe.  Down for 2 days.  I'll never eat here again.

It was my first time here and my friend and I came to order to-go and it wasn't that busy so the guy came over and helped us order. But he kept leaving in the middle of us paying and forgetting about us and forgot about our food. What should have been a 20 minute wait max turned into a 45 min wait.
The service and food options are good. I just find this place a bit over priced for pizza. 2 salads, soup, kids pizza, three beers... $60 dollars. A bit over priced.

I love the food at California Pizza Kitchen. Their hummus appetizer is one of my favorites (the bread is more like pizza dough than regular pita). Their lettuce wraps are another one we always get. The pear and gorgonzola pizza is amazing and comes topped with a mountain of salad greens.  That is where the good ends though. We had pretty much quit visiting this location years ago because of poor service. On a whim we decided to grab dinner here this past week and once again, the service nearly ruined it. Our server was wonderful. The hostess was very friendly. Alas, the cook messed up one of our entrees. That meal came out after the rest of the party was done eating. Our server was nice about it and apologized, but honestly, in that kind of situation a manager needs to come to the table and say something. And honestly, my expectation was that they would adjust our check in some way to compensate for the messed up meal. But none of that happened.  So, I'm probably not coming back here for a long time. I still love CPK's food, but I'll have to find another location to visit.

I tried this place for the first time ever. The pizza is amazing. I ordered a Strawberry Mojito, it was watered down and not enough strawberries. Stick to the pizza. The cocktail drinks need a better bartender/mixologist.
Didn't impress me but they do have a few good entrees. Reg white and pepp pizzas are good as well as jerk pasta I think....?
It was my first time at California Pizza Kitchen and Dano was our server. My goodness! I've never had such amazing service. The food tasted fantastic and I will definitely go back.

Good is good as always, but service could be a little better. I ate here for lunch with my husband and they forgot to give us their complementary bread and herb olive oil (we had remind them). My husband ordered a soda after getting our salads and our waitress (Cat) forgot to bring it out. We had to remind her. Service is friendly and welcoming whenever we eat at this location. Nice place to get lunch or dinner if you're out shopping in Waterford.

Food is always good. Me and the wifey got our usual Caesar salad with salmon and the Jamaican jerk pizza which is thin crust. We were there an hour before after they opened so we didn't wait at all to get seated. Customer service was ok and could have been better if our server remembered things. She forgot to give us bread and forgot our soda order as well, but overall the food came out fast and tastes delicious as usual.
I come here just for their cedar plank salmon and salads! Large portions, very clean, tasty food, great prices, friendly staff...what more can you ask for? Never left this place feeling disappointed.

Jeff the GM, was amazing!!!! Long story short I had the best cob salad ever!!! Everything was fresh and came out really quick. Our waitress Lenaya was amazing too. She said she had been at work ALL day and still had a smile on her face. Over all the service was the best and I recommend everyone to go to this location.
Dining isn't all that special but the employees are really nice and their spicy chipotle chicken pizza is soo good.
Kenny was a very attentive server, bbq chicken pizza was great, roasted veggie salad was delicious.

I've frequented CPK often and the good news is things don't change much between visits. On my most recent trip I tried a new spinach and quinoa salad that was quite good! I also branched out and went with a turkey and brie sandwich, another solid choice. The service was pretty good and the food was tasty... with an affordable lunch menu it's a great stop.

Perfect quick dinner.  Shrimp Jambylia with fetucinni.  Had the perfect sense of spiciness.  Rest had Kung Pao with shrimp.   Dessert was chocolate soufflé and hot butter cake.  Fast accurate service!!

Been here twice! I would say their cocktails are the best! The pizza? Just ok, but I know other pizza places around the area that are more flavorful. I feel like their pizza lacks taste... I mostly eat veggie pizzas and you would think that because it's just veggies, I am not going to get lots of flavor. Not true though... cheeses and spices give flavor and other pizza places know how to make a perfect match. Again, not bad... just ok. However, again, cocktails are awesome (try their blood orange sangria), the place is clean and the service is good.

CPK is really good. I am super picky about pizza (being from the north) so it's truly a good pizza if I like it.  CPK always starts you out with bread and olive oil and herbs for dipping. It's awesome. It usually comes out with the drinks, which I suggest any of their frozen lemonades. Mmmm.  Tonight I went with my mom and we both ordered hand tossed pizzas. She ordered the pepperoni and I ordered the Hawaiian. The pepperoni is really a traditional pepperoni pizza. Just personal pan. The Hawaiian is also very traditional except CPK uses big slices of thin ham. I love it because it's a sweet yet salty cured ham. Of course there is pineapple as well.  We had a really awesome server tonight... I wish I remembered his name. All I remembered was how he suggested the butter cake for dessert.... lol. But he was great. He was making suggestions left and right as well as making sure everything tasted right for us.  It cost about $35 for two personal pizzas and two drinks. Not bad.

Are you shocked to see a 5 star rating despite the overall reviews? Here's why --- Customer Service by Management is ON POINT! Jamarie: You rock!!! I'm a mother of twin toddlers and having a place that does take out curbside is essential! Clearly I'm not going to unload, grab food, and reload. Definitely don't want to go to jail either for leaving kids in the car to pick up an order. I don't have that many arms and it's just too much.  I had a friend from out of town come over for a play date with her toddler. It was a Friday at noon. I went to pick up our order. My BIGGEST pet peeve is placing any kind of order and it not be complete when you come home and discover this annoyance. Now with screaming toddlers it's chaos and unspeakable. Literally no kids meal and half our order was missing. I won't lie -- we were pissed.  I called and got the Manager, Jamarie. She was so polite and offered to remake our food and comp our meal. She asked that I return in 15 min to pick up. After much thought and kids going crazy I called her back and told her to forget it because there was no possible way I could return. Just imagine (3) toddlers beyond the point of return on hunger looking at us like we are bad mothers as we fed them wheat thins -- it's scary.  Jamarie offered to have someone drive the food to my house bc it was ready. I was shocked by her generosity.  THIS is a perfect example of EXCELLENT Customer Service and because of this I was be ordering again.  Thank you Jamarie!!!

Thin Crust Artichoke and Spinach Pizza!  Delicious and balanced with a medium size layer of cheese. This is my second best pizza after the Original Barbeque pizza they make.  Light pizza but fills a hungry 6 foot 180 pounds male.  Service was so nice and fast at 9:00 PM on a Saturday. To be honest, on another day we went earlier and the service was a bit slower and we got 2 rounds of bread and oil before the pizza arrived. Still was a good pizza. I recommend it to you!  Don't forget to download their application and collect rewards.

Good food for a nice price. The staff were very friendly and helpful.  To drink I had the frozen raspberry lemonade which was refreshing and sweet. For appetizers, I tasted their bianco california flatbread which was crispy and tasty. Also, their baked potato soup was very delicious and probably my favorite thing I ate there. As a main course I had the sicilian flatbread pizza which was good but less crispy than I was hoping for. For dessert I had the salted caramel pudding which was very tasty and balanced well (it wasn't too sweet; it was perfect). Overall I had a pleasant experience and will likely return. Also, that 20% of student discount for UCF students on Tuesdays is great incentive!

Food was good but service was some sort of dissapointing. Maybe it was because we aarived late but still there is no excuse for serving in a rush or without being interested in your guests. We went for a nice dinner but it turned out a rush date... in the past I had Beyer experience at this location... upset

The customer service is great. Their signature pizzas are good. Their dough seems a bit bland and even with a ton of toppings there's no pizzazz to the pizzas. They're not bad, just not as tasteful as I would expect.

This California Pizza Kitchen is located in the vast Waterford Lake Plaza. That being said, parking is not easy to come by most of the time. This is your usual chain restaurant, but there's nothing wrong with being a chain restaurant.  This California Pizza Kitchen offers indoor and outdoor seating.  On the inside, the kitchen (including the wood burning pizza oven) is in full view.  Our waiter (I can't remember his name, but he kept encouraging my friend and I to "enjoy the weekend.") was very charismatic, attentive and great and suggesting certain menu items.   Every meal starts with a plate of complimentary bread with olive oil and herbs for dipping.  I chose to also start with a bowl of their baked potato soup.  It was good, but nothing out of the ordinary as far as this type of soup goes.  For my main course, I opted for the five cheese and tomato pizza.  The pizza tastes homemade with a crust that's crispy, yet soft in the right spots.  The cheeses made it ooey-gooey and the fresh tomato cut through the creamy cheese and lessened the guilt of eating the whole (small) pizza.

I saw the previous reviews for this place are pretty high, maybe I came on a bad day but I definitely don't think this place is worth 4 stars. I've been to CPK millions of times in Miami and this is the first time I visited this location in Waterford Lakes. The location is great, it is only minutes from my complex but wow the food was just so so. I think for the price I would've rather have gone to Goodfella's for far superior pizza. The pizza here is overpriced considering the blahness of the pizza. Sadly the best thing about my meal was the free bread that comes with the olive oil, that was absolutely delicious. I also ordered a sangria flight which was overly sweet and a small plate of chips and guac. It pains me to pay $41.30 for my meal. My boyfriend and I ate our pizza (not all of it but most of it) because we have been up since 7 am and we've been moving so we were starving when we came but honestly I will probably never come again. I recommend Goodfella's for pizza it's only a few minutes away from this location if good pizza is what you're looking for. Now that I think of it, the Magerita CPK pizza you get in the frozen isle and bake yourself is far superior to the one I had today which is sad. I'm so sad to have disliked this so much because I've been a fan of CPK for years but I think my love for this place is done. *After posting this review I spoke to the manager and he listened to my complaints and was very nice about trying to figure out what the issue was. He reimbursed me for my meal and apologized for it not being up to par which I appreciated.

I cannot believe I have not eaten here before!  I had the spinach and shaved mushroom pizza with a salad lunch combo. The salad was fresh and the pizza crust was perfect. I will definitely be going back!  Our waitress was wonderful too she did not rush us and said she would wait until we signaled her to order. Now that I think about it I might just head over there tonight!

Free refills on the lemonade, I appreciate this because most places charge you another $3 for a glass of specialty lemonade. Free bread and oil which was delicious. Customer service is perfect, my server was very nice and had great charisma, I would definitely come back for lunch.
For a chain restaurant, this place is amazingly consistent in their food.

Went there yesterday as a party of four. Service was very good and food was very good.  But my real commendation goes to the honesty of the employee who found my small wallet that I had accidentally left behind. The wallet contained $250 and when I called the next day frantically searching for my wallet I was told it was there. I was so impressed that every cent was accounted for. THANK YOU FOR YOUR HONESTY and for safely storing it until I could get there.

All the CPKs are usually awesome but I wanted to come say this one especially rocks because our waiter was a super cool guy (and now I can't for the life of me remember his name) but also during the meal, I saw another waiter having a lot of good fun interactions with his table so there seems to be a really great staff at this location.

I signed up for the club and received a free small plateI chose the crispy macaroni and cheese that was good. You got 4 panko-crusted mac & cheese bites that word crispy outside and cheesy inside. I will get those again. The staff was friendly and the decor was updated cozy and welcoming.

I can't believe I've grown up by Waterford Lakes and I've never been here. I started with the avocado egg rolls which were good right out of the fryer. I followed up by sharing a pizza with the wife. At first I thought it would be bigger but was happy with my decision as it was just enough pizza (I'm trying not to be fat anymore). The server was awesome considering there were four little kids at the table. I also enjoyed the ambience of the place. I'm definitely going to make it a point to return.
By Orlando standards, CPK has a more relaxed and quieter dining room.  Pizzas are made fresh to order and are available for take-out if you call ahead

I was in a hurry. I came late for a team lunch and got to leave eatly, but our server was anle to help me out. Got my 50/50 sweet tea and my Bianco Flatbread on a flight. Imagine that he had to take care of 15 others, but he did it. There was a little sign telling you who the Certified Pizza Chef of the day is. What a cool idea for a pizzeria! My first visit to this location, but I am impressed with the service. I plan to bring my family back. Left him big tips, I felt good hurrying up to return for a meeting. California Pizza Kitchen Waterford Lakes Town Center $$

CPK at Waterford Lakes is always tasty. They have lots of convenient parking, a nice outdoor patio area, a full bar and all booth seating. They have lots of pizza and salad but they have some premium entrees also. They had halibut and a ribeye on the menu. We always have pretty decent service here. Pleasant and fairly quick. We had a couple flatbreads and a half salad. Everything was good. We tried the fall Brussels sprout bacon flatbread. Very tasty. The one thing that  was off was I couldn't get my favorite salad or pizza bc they had no avocado bc of the high price of them now, I'm guessing. We also wanted avocado chicken egg rolls and was told they'd be all chicken lol. So if you're catching the pattern, I love avocado and was sad it wasn't available . It's kind of their signature salad. But we will be back. It was still very tasty.
Good, consistent spot. Friendly service. Good food. Not just pizza (good salads, pastas, etc.).

One of the best experiences I had in a while. My boyfriend and I came in an hour before they closed. The restaurant was almost empty but we didn't feel rushed at all. The server, named Kai, was absolutely amazing. He did everything to make sure we had a great time. It was my first time trying Chipotle Pizza and it was phenomenal!

We had the chicken piccata and margherita pizza. Both were setved quickly and the flavor was excellent. Also had the red wine sangria and strawberry margarita which were excellent as well. Our server, Tyler, was very attentive and funny. Will definitely come back!

Of all the chains, if I must eat at a chain, this one has some of the better, fresher and varied options. I had the Moroccan salad (beets, avocado, chicken, peanuts). It wasn't overdressed and lettuce was crisp. Fresh and tasty. Service was quick, friendly. Half and full sizes are available. Half was plenty. Interior looked a bit worn and could be cleaner. Parking is tough. Prices were fine for the quality. Overall fresh, quick meal at a good value.

Our first visit to a California Pizza Kitchen took place on a weeknight. We were greeted nicely, seated immediately and approached by our server, Kenny. He was friendly, knowledgeable and attentive throughout our meal.  I went with the personal sized BBQ pizza while my dining partner went with an entree' salad. The food arrived a bit more slowly than we would have anticipated but temperatures were appropriately hot and cold and was attractive. Portions were large and some diners may choose to split a pizza (or salad) along with an app (or two). We ended up with a 'to go" container stuffed with much of the dinner salad. The restaurant was clean and attractive. At the same time, I continue to be amazed at the number of relatively dimly lit restaurants that incorporate "reverse type" and smaller fonts sizes on their menus. Such designs  might generate recognition for the creative staff but often alienates diners over age 40...or maybe less. All in all a nice experience led by our server and a tasty BBQ pizza. Special requests (ie: "BBQ pizza on thin crust versus "hand tossed") are more pricey than needed so flexibility isn't popular with the CPK folks. Nevertheless, if you're in the area you shouldn't be disappointed if you select this spot over the numerous options within walking distance.

My wife and daughter stopped in after our daughter had had a long day on the road with the school bands (she plays in Symphony, Jazz Band, and Jazz Ensemble.). The school had two MPA assessments on the other side of town. I had meetings that night; but, they were kind enough to bring me some left over Avocado Club Egg Rolls, which were simply delicious.  The fried wonton rolls were filled with avocado, chicken, cheese and bacon, which would have been delicious enough... but, with the addition of a spicey ranch dressing, they were out of this world! Later in the night, I snuck in to the kitchen and snagged the remaining Roasted Garlic Chicken Pizza; and, devoured it.  There wasn't much chicken left, but the roasted garlic was sweet and savory; and, the red onions were tender; and, provided a nice counterpoint.  The pizza dough is very good, with the chewiness and yeastiness that I prize in a hand-tossed pizza.

Located in beautiful Orlando how can this not be a great write up. I visited this place on my birthday and had the butter cake and a glass of wine at the bar. My girlfriend ordered wine and a flatbread. The ambiance was great and the wine was refreshing. Located near great shopping and in a beautiful landscaped facility this place was awesome. Coming here for a lunch, date night or with the kids would work out great. What would be awesome if on weekends they could have live music, ah a wish. Thanks CPK for making my birthday great!
The thin crust  "Sicilian pizza" is still my favorite spicy pizza. Ideal for two, but enough for three if you add the Waldorf salad to share. Reasonably priced and packs a gastronomic delight.

Anu, the assistant general manager is simply amazing. She made sure we had a good time, that our food is properly made.  She is doing above and beyond for the customer satisfaction.  Corina our waitress, made sure that too.  We will coming back like every week for sure.  Ps: do not change the chocolate soufflée recipe.

Dinner tonight @CPK in Waterford lakes was amazing !! #1 reason was the service .. our server SARAH was amazing so kind to kids and so attentive to everything... been to tones of Resturant but never had service like this!!. #2 great food .. loved all the new items in menu!!  Will be back for sure!!

I adore this businesses food. My favorite item off their entire menu is the baked potato soup. My boyfriend and I order that and Farmers market soup  every time we go. I also like their flatbreads! They are amazing. My favorite is the spinach and mushroom flatbreads  Sometimes we dine in, most of the time we do take our and just recently we did the curb side.  I liked how convenient it was to just call in our order, park in the curb side parking and they will bring your food out. If you ask, sometimes they will give you bread with olive oil on the side. It's delicious .  Their take out usually takes a little longer than expected sometimes due to the crowd they have dining in, but they offer you waters while you sit at the bar next to the take out.  Make your way over to California pizza kitchen!

Don't waste your money on drinks. Spent $10 on a frozen margarita and it was so icey I couldn't drink it because the ice would get stuck in the straw. They also came out after our food. Food was average, chicken tasted like cardboard. Service was good
I do take out mostly with this location. And every time it's perfect. Love the food and the staff. Good ppl

Friday night date night and we decided to pick CPK for our love of pizza. We got there and were seated very quickly. They offer different speciality pizzas that come in  personal size. I ordered the Jamaican jerk pizza which is my favorite. It has enough spice to keep me satisfied and has a little sweetness that keeps you wanting more. The pizza comes cut in six slices and easy to share between 2 people. My gf ordered the Sicilian pizza which is also a favorite. Comes with all different types of meats and has a little bit of spiciness. All the flavors come together to form a great taste.  If you join their loyalty club it's easy to gain rewards. We had $10 and used it on the avocado egg rolls. The eggs rolls aren't that great compared to other restaurants. It comes with ranch dressing. The service was excellent and the vibe is casual throughout the restaurant. CPk is a local favorite. Pizzas are a little pricey but they do have excellent taste.

Hello once again from Orlando this is the California Pizza Kitchen over here by Waterford Lakes it is absolutely wonderful.  Everything from the pizza which I'm not even sure what it's called was fantastic it's the carne asada and it was to die for. In addition to the pizza we had fried macaroni and cheese which was really good the cheese sauce was excellent. They even remembered to bring us bread this time, which was one of my complaints on the last visit we had here. It was fresh and very hot still from the oven and it was great. The service here was excellent. We were greeted at the door by a young lady and she was very courteous and welcoming and she even smiled! Our server Marty was very professional did a great job and we even talked to the manager Jeff, who was very friendly and made sure that our experience here in California Pizza Kitchen was top-notch!   We appreciate it and will be coming back here more frequently.

Today was the day after Hurricane Irma hit and we decided to go to California Pizza Kitchen for lunch and to get out of the house. Even though they hadn't gotten new deliveries (because of the hurricane) they were still serving fresh food to an insane amount of people. Our server Mike was amazing and we spoke with the Assistant Manager for a bit (I can't remember her name but she was so so sweet) and she made sure we were served well. I ordered a soup that they were out of and they were so apologetic that they gave me a different meal of my choosing for free. I was in no way expecting this and would never in a million years ask an establishment to give me free food, so this came as a total surprise. With all the stress of the hurricane this particular California Pizza Kitchen completely made my day so much better. They also talked to all of us (we're younger college students) to make sure that we made it through the hurricane okay. Honestly the food was great as always and the service was legitimately the best service I have ever gotten when going out to eat. The people working here are so genuinely kind and they really care that everyone who eats there has a positive experience.
While other restaurants were closed the day after hurricane Irma California pizza kitchen was open and serving great food five stars
One of my favorite chain restaurants, never disappoints, service is great very welcoming.

Excellent service, nice atmosphere! Our waitress Bianca was very accommodating. Spinach dip was delicious. The garlic cream fettuccine was outstanding! We also had the Maurgerita Pizza- it had thin crust, it was amazing! Definitely will come back!
Love coming to CPK they have wine down Wednesday which it has 1/2 off the wines. The pound cake it's great.

I need help here people! My sister and I ordered peach and mango mimosas! What I received was flavored champagne. As a frequent bruncher I KNOW that mimosas are comprised of champagne and orange juice--regardless of additional flavoring. When I asked my server she proceeded to tell me that other people may make their mimosas with orange juice but they don't. WAIT. WHAT?? It's like saying sorry we just done make out jack and coke with coke. Other people might do that but not us.... so can I please get some clarification? If that is not how you make your mimosas then you should advertise it as flavored champagne and not a mimosa. Overall she was pleasant and accommodated our request for orange juice but this is just not how a mimosa is made.

I decided to go here for a date night with my boyfriend but ended up having not as good of a time. Honestly the only good thing was the food and sangria. The service was terrible! Our waiter took 10 minutes to acknowledge us and ask us for our drink and food orders. I specifically asked to have my sangria come out when the food came out and instead it came out early. We also had to ask for straws and bread. I've been to other CPKs and had amazing service maybe he waiter was just having a bad night.

I love pizza! California Pizza Kitchen has decent pizza and other options for non pizza eaters(I don't even think it's possible not to like pizza).  My friend was having a farewell party and opted for this restaurant we were a large party and our waiter Tyler was amazing.  He was very patient with us and made sure we had everything we needed while dining.  Before getting our food I decided to try their sangria flight. Yes it was a flight with 3 different sangrias. The first one I tried was the traditional berry sangria not too sweet and quite refreshing. The second one was the orchard sangria which I was told was quite popular. I found it tasty but it wasn't my favorite. The third sangria was the beehive sangria which I liked a lot. The bartender told me it was the least popular because it was very sweet. It worked for me because I do have a sweet tooth. For dinner I ordered the three cheese pizza with tomatoes and fresh basil. I thought at first that I would have to take half of my food home but I ended up eating the whole pizza. My verdict is: when in doubt less is more. This pizza was a white pizza, the cheeses were a great balance and the basil made it epic.  My overall experience was great. The service was also awesome.

Had a wonderful dinner here with my girlfriend. The host Cristina was very kind, our server Mike was spot on, and Javier the pizza chef did an awesome job with my pizza. My girlfriend had the short rib w/ mac n' cheese and she loved it. Will be visiting again!

Absolutely loved it. The hostess Cristina was wonderful, and our waiter Mike was very attentive and efficient. I got the short ribs with chipotle Mac n' cheese and I didn't want to stop eating it because it was so delicious. The appetizer--tortilla Baja and Thai chicken rolls--were also amazing. The fresh guacamole and peanut sauce dips were killer too. You can also buy discounted movie vouchers for the regal nearby with your bill which is an added bonus. I can't wait to go back!
